Follow this things to success and enjoy the game:
1. Take a radio with you if you will find to hear some nice music while you're doing your tests.
2. Complete all her tests...
3. Destroy Her cameras.
4. Annoy her!!! (don't ask me why...you will see it yourself when you will play the game).
5. Finish her and her "business".
6. Take your prize and enjoy! :)

Portal - Это очень интересная головолмка с портальной пушкой (которая ставит порталы). 
Сюжет банальный, вы находитесь в какой-то лаборатории (Aperture Science). И робот по имени Гладос говорит вам пройти 19 тестовых камер. В этих камерах и есть вся суть игры. Гледос говорит что после прохождения всех камер вы попадете на вечеринку с тортом, но она вас обманывает и вам нужно выжить и убить ее.
Good and exciting game even tho i played it in 2016

Game's good.

Arguably one of the best games to ever play with your emotions

From the sp00ky reveals to the really difficult puzzle's, this game will bend your brain in 8 different places; a feeling i quite like.
Get it together with Portal 2, as both are exceptionally well done, with 2 having the most story to it.

PRO'S:
- Immensely good puzzle's
- Seriously good storyline
- Great voice acting
- Real good humour

CON'S:
- On the short side, but for €2 and the mental blow it will give you, i'd say it's neutral

Conclusion;
Have you bought it yet?... you should...
It's short, but every minute of it is amazing!

Curtissimo, terminei em 2 horas, queria não ter dado tanto pause pra comer assim teria dado tempo de reembolsar isso e jogar ate o final kasdafsafasdf.
Puzzles nada dificeis, a "luta" contra a Glados n foi nada dificil, e o modo q chegamos até ela foi idiota, mas preciso, se enrolasse por mais 3 horas de puzzles faceis sem dar dicas da historia eu me mataria...
Unica coisa que salva são os Cores que em 10 segundos com cada 1 deles eu gostei mais deles que da Chell e da Glados.
Eu particulamente falando gostei do jogo 
mas "eu critico" não achei tão legal assim
mas de fato o jogo tem seus lados bons, ele tem uma mecanica muito interessante e que pode ser explorada (eu sei que no portal 2 ela vai ser, mas aq é review de portal 1 entao fued4se) e as referencias a Black Mesa são otimas

WHY HAVEN'T YOU BOUGHT THIS YET?!

Portal is a single-player, first-person shooter puzzle game developed and published by Valve Corporation. The game was released in a bundle package known as The Orange Box for PC, Xbox 360 and PlayStation 3 on October 9, 2007, along side with  Half-Life 2, Half-Life 2: Episode One, Half-Life 2: Episode Two, and Team Fortress 2. The game consists of a series of puzzles which must be solved by telporting the character using the Portal Gun. Graphics looks slightly better than HL2 games, the light and reflection are way more detailed, as for the gameplay, it's completly different than the other 4 games in TOB. In this game you have just one weapon, which is not really a weapon, more of a tool and it can't shoot bullets or anything like that, just portals. The Portal Gun is very helpful and you can do alot of fun things such as long jumping, the iconic wall-floor infinite free-falling and throwing diffrent objects through portals. The level designs are so creative and fun that everything is well balanced. You feel the missions and tests challenging and yet, not frustrating. You know that it's hard and you have to think how to get in some place, but you know it's not impossible and there's some trick behind it. Honestly, when I shoot 2 portals to walls to see as who am I playing as, I was very surprised. I expected some tough guy, but no, it was a nice woman. She looked really tired, but I know she will look way better in Portal 2 XD. Overall, it's a unique game, if you want a different type of first-person game, that is not a shooter, a surgery simulator or a horror-survival game, then this is for you!

PERSONAL RATE: 9.5/10
One of the greatest puzzle games out there. Do yourself a favor and buy this and Portal 2. You will not regret it.

Ce jeu ne sert à mon sens qu'à comprendre quelque reference de Portal 2

en effet j'ai joué  portal 2 avant Portal donc je ne pouvais etre que deçu :
-les salles sont beaucoup trop simple
-le jeu est beaucoup trop court
-l'histoire est mal exploité et repetitive

en conclusion je n'ai pas vraiment aimé le jeu c'est un bon jeu de puzzle mais sur portal personnelement je cherche l'histoire et ici elle est inexistante et previsible* !

Mais heureusement Valve s'est tres bien ratrappé sur Portal 2 qui est à mon sens l'un des meilleur jeu auquel j'ai joué


* : ATTENTION SPOILER : je n'ai meme pas compris comment et pourquoi on est arrivé jusque GlaDos, le jeu m'a personnellement donné l'impression d'etre fait à la va vite !

[h1] Portal, la reina de todos los puzzles. [/h1]

A mi criterio Portal es una pequeña muestra, casi un modelo de cómo sería un videojuego perfecto. Da cátedra, por así decirlo, de cómo debe ser un videojuego. [b] La sencillez de sus premisas y la complejidad de sus conclusiones la transforman en uno de esos videojuegos que difícilmente pueden verse superados. [/b]

Corta, intensa, extraña y muy satisfactoria aventura en primera persona. Portal logra con muy poco, lo que cientos de juegos con muchísimas cosas no pueden ni siquiera aparentar: un videojuego integrado. La ambientación es terriblemente bien lograda, el guion milimétricamente cuidado (a pesar incluso de la dificultad de que solo hay un personaje que hable en todo el videojuego), la narrativa visual correctamente desarrollada, la jugabilidad es de lo mejor y de lo más original que se ha hecho en toda la industria de los videojuegos, la musicalización coherente al estilo empleado, los gráficos más que aceptables, el desarrollo de personajes es sencillamente brillante, el diseño de niveles creativo, ingenioso y definido, la historia es misteriosa, repleta de intriga, y fiel a costumbre de Valve esconde más de lo que muestra.

Todos estos aspectos junto a otros más, perfectamente integrados, pensados como un conjunto, de forma coherente. Eso transforma a este juego en un todo, donde no se puede separar las mecánicas de jugabilidad de la iluminación, o del guion o de lo que fuere. Todos los aspectos individuales se potencian unos con otros, y ninguno se destaca más que otro, o por lo menos no en demasía.
